item.title: The L805 photo printer from Epson features a six-colour ink tank system
item.description: Source: Epson. The L805 ink tank photo printer. Epson, a company that provides digital imaging and printing products, has released its L805 printer. This six-color ink tank photo printer offers wireless printing from mobile devices and boasts the lowest operating expenses on the market. Epson’s ink tank printers are unique in that they utilize large ink tanks instead of cartridges. Building upon the previous L800 model, the L805 incorporates built-in wireless connectivity.

item.title: The Epson WorkForce Pro WF-C869R offers a cost-effective solution for businesses
item.description: Source: Epson Singapore. The WF-C869R printer. Epson recently introduced a new printer with a Replaceable Ink Pack System (RIPS) that offers both high speed and quality while significantly reducing costs. The WorkForce Pro WF-C869R boasts a high page yield and a low cost per page, which can lead to considerable savings for businesses compared to using laser printers. The printer’s high-capacity ink packs come in two options: standard packs that yield up to 22,500 black and 22,000 color pages, and larger packs that yield up to 86,000 black and 84,000 color pages.

item.title: Epson introduces a new business printer capable of printing up to 75,000 pages in a single run
item.description: Epson helps businesses reduce printing expenses with its Replaceable Ink Pack System (RIPS). RIPS utilizes high-capacity ink packs that hold significantly more ink than traditional cartridges. This system combines the convenience of cartridges with the high-volume output of ink tanks. Source: Epson. The Epson WorkForce Pro WF-R8591 is the first printer in Southeast Asia to offer this technology. Using a complete set of ink packs, the WF-R8591 can print approximately 75,000 pages* before replacements are needed.
